overview_of_class: The concepts and practices of advanced object-oriented software design and development are covered in this course. Students' students' programming foundation is enhanced through study of advanced concepts behind object orientation, including role-based programming, advanced concepts of inheritance, interface development, design patterns, and test-driven development. Using this foundation, students learn the real-world aspects of object orientation by putting the concepts into practice and by using a contemporary object-oriented programming language.
name: Intermediate  Programming
title: SCS CIS 314-CN-16 Intermediate  Programming

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: The concepts and practices of advanced object-oriented software design and development are covered in this course. Students' students' programming foundation is enhanced through study of advanced concepts behind object orientation, including role-based programming, advanced concepts of inheritance, interface development, design patterns, and test-driven development. Using this foundation, students learn the real-world aspects of object orientation by putting the concepts into practice and by using a contemporary object-oriented programming language.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: CIS 212 or equivalent programming course. May not be audited or taken P/N.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
Upon completion of this course, the student will be able to:
?Write, compile and execute complex object oriented programs.
?Build robust applications using object-oriented features such as information hiding, encapsulation, inheritance, polymorphism, composition and exception handling.
?Implement object oriented programs using complex data structures such as arrays, linked lists, hash tables, trees, etc.
?Create robust applications using object oriented class libraries.

subject: CIS
